dcsl_swarm_director Documentation

dcsl_swarm_director: Routes TwistArray message into Twist messages on separate topics.

The dcsl_swarm_director package contains the dcsl_swarm_director node that subscribes to the cmd_vel_array topic with TwistArray messages and publishes cmd_velX topics with Twist messages where X is the array index from the TwistArray. It is designed for use with multi-agent systems.

  • Homepage: http://ros.org/wiki/dcsl_swarm_director

dcsl_swarm_director

This node subscribes to a TwistArray message and publishes each Twist in the TwistArray as a Twist messsage on new topics. It can be used to unpack commands send to multi-agent systems.

ROS API

List of nodes:

  • dcsl_swarm_director

dcsl_swarm_director

Usage

$ dcsl_swarm_director [standard ROS args]

ROS topics

Subscribes to (name / type):

  • "cmd_vel_array/TwistArray" : An array of Twist messages. TwistArray is defined in the dcsl_messages package.

Publishes to (name / type):

  • "cmd_vel0/Twist" : The Twist messsage contained in the 0th entry of the subscribed TwistArray
  • "cmd_vel1/Twist" : The Twist message contained in the 1st entry of the subscribed TwistArray ...
  • "cmd_velN/Twist" : The Twist message contained in the Nth entry of the subscibed Twist Array

ROS parameters

  • "/n_robots" : The number of Twist messages to expect in the TwistArray. This defines how many topics to publish Twist messages to.
